text: (upbeat music)
- Veriff is a company that's on a mission
to bring back trust in our digital lives.

Instead of dealing with
very specific industries
or very specific geographies,

we deal with all of them
so we get a lot of data,
and that allows us to be more responsive,
and be more proactive as well at times

with what can happen
with these technologies.
And so first, migrating to SageMaker

was driven by the need to
simplify our operations.
So for us now, it's actually 27% less cost

to retrain a model, which
is very significant,

because we've been able to
mutualize the infrastructure
supporting all these models,
and this element has allowed us

to be much more competitive
on our pricing as well.
We started using AWS Rekognition

for face recognition,
face matching, et cetera.

And that has been a very
welcomed improvement
for our customers.
It's actually a very demanding process
to do this verification we do,

and it takes seconds, but the
goal is to take it sub-second.

And in the last six months,
we've seen that we are,
I'd say 30, 40% closer to this goal.
So that's where we have a great advantage

working with AWS, and
collaborating on our solutions.
But of course, what's going on here
is the virtue of the human expertise,
it allows us to always have a solution
for any use case we have,

even though the technology
may always be there.
But also automation means that we are good
at catching up the machine level
and taking price down, et cetera.

This level of automation
is very important as well,

to stay competitive, but also
to keep being a tech company
that moves the plot forward.
